defaultImageGalleryTitle: Engrafted ERMS tumor in the cranium from transplantation
researchInterest: Our main research interest is in understanding pathogenesis of cancer using zebrafish and mammalian experimental systems.  Our current research focuses on dissecting cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying the pathogenesis of pediatric rhabdomyosarcoma, in particular the key events regulating tumor differentiation, relapse and metastasis. My laboratory utilizes chemical genetic, functional genomic and genome engineering approaches to identify key driver events of rhabdomyosarcoma.
